fields.Title of Contribution: Gravity & Einstein: Assessing the Rubber Sheet Analogy in Undergraduate Conceptual Physics
fields.Description/Abstract: Researchers have often investigated introductory physics students’ understanding of gravity through the Newtonian “action-at-a-distance” model of gravitational force. This study further explores students’ understanding by including the rubber sheet analogy as a physical model for Einstein’s theory of gravitational fields associated with the curvature of space-time. The research data, which includes measures of N = 101 general education university students’ pre- and post-instruction performance on a Gravity Concept Inventory, indicates instruction on the rubber sheet analogy can be moderately successful at reducing the prevalence of students’ misconceptions about gravity, including students’ beliefs that atmosphere, rotation, and magnetism affect gravity.  Results suggest typical normalized gains among students were approximately 40%, moderated by potentially educationally significant differences associated with the age and sex of students.
